thread.title: U-E grad donates orange football jerseys to Tigers
thread.title_full: U-E grad donates orange football jerseys to Tigers

title: U-E grad donates orange football jerseys to Tigers
text:
U-E grad donates orange football jerseys to Tigers 
By wbng sports October 23, 2015 Updated Oct 23, 2015 at 6:48 PM EDT 
Endicott, NY (WBNG Binghamton) Union-Endicott football will be unveiling special orange uniforms on senior night against Horseheads on Friday. The uniforms and new cleats were donated by U-E grad and current MLB pitcher Jim Johnson. 
The school was thrilled the 2001 grad, who helped the Tigers win a state baseball title his senior year, decided to help out some of the current student-athletes. 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
"I'm more appreciative of the type of guy that he is and the fact that he has remembered where he came from and is proud of Union-Endicott and wanted to help out the current students," said Josh Gannon, the U-E athletics director. "Even more than that, just proud of the role model that he is for our kids." 
"He is the kind of guy who is well-respected in the community and if he knew about the fanfare that is being involved right now, he doesn't look for that type of limelight," said head coach Tom Baleno. "That is really a great definition of what generosity truly is." 
U-E closes out the season this week before playing Maine-Endwell in the Section IV Class A semifinals next weekend. To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required.
